content.text:
# Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series__disambig_1

}}
The Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series is an award given by the Screen Actors Guild to honor the finest acting achievements in Dramatic Television.
Julianna Margulies holds the record for most nominations in this category with nine as well as the most wins with four, two for ER and two for The Good Wife. Gillian Anderson and Edie Falco each have three wins followed by Viola Davis, Claire Foy, Allison Janney, and Sandra Oh with two wins.
Winners and nominees
won for Picket Fences in 1994.]]
won three times, twice for The X-Files (1995, 1996) and once for The Crown (2020)]]
won four times, twice for ER (1997, 1998), and twice for The Good Wife (2009, 2010)]]
won three times for The Sopranos (1999, 2002, and 2007)]]
won twice for The West Wing (2000, 2000)]]
won for Six Feet Under (2003)]]
won for Alias (2004).]]
won twice for ''Grey's Anatomy (2005) and Killing Eve (2018)]]
won for Grey's Anatomy (2006).]]
won for Brothers & Sisters (2008).]]
won for American Horror Story (2010).]]
won for Homeland (2012).]]
won for Downton Abbey (2013).]]
won twice for How to Get Away with Murder (2014, 2015)]]
won twice for The Crown (2016, 2017)]]
won for Squid Game (2021).]]
won for The White Lotus (2022).]]
won for The Crown (2023).]]
won for Shōgun (2024).]]
